author: bridge-bot
content:
<nibnalin> It looks like the recommended address for the P256VERIFY precompile is different between EIP-7212 and RIP-7212 -- I think it would be better to redirect both proposals to the same page to avoid confusion, not sure who runs the website -- https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7212

cc @adietrichs

author: bridge-bot
content: <SamWilsn> I'm not entirely sure what to do with 7212

author: bridge-bot
content: <SamWilsn> Would make the most sense to integrate rendering the two sites, but I'm not sure what the plan is overall.

author: bridge-bot
content: <nibnalin> Makes sense, the most immediate thing is that PRECOMPILED_ADDRESS in the EIP is not the same as the RIP, and I can imagine this causing confusion, should I make a PR to make them the same?

author: bridge-bot
content: <SamWilsn> That'd be up to the authors of it

author: abcoathup
content:
EIP7212 was meant to be removed, as it was moved from an EIP to a RIP.  Otherwise RIP would have been issued a new number.  
As per the discussion in the PR:
https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/pull/5#pullrequestreview-1789799774

author: bridge-bot
content: <ulerdogan> I think the plan should be removing EIP-7212 as it migrated to an RIP and there is kind of conflict by numbers. There is an open PR for that, but have blockers: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8101 (re @nibnalin: Makes sense, the most immediate thing is that PRECOMPILED_ADDRESS in the EIP is not the same as the RIP, and I can imagine this causing confusion, should I make a PR to make them the same?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dcposch> I don't quite understand why the RIP returns empty data instead of 0 / 1 now. https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/pull/19/files#r1602718444

In that case, how does a contract tell whether the precompile exists?

author: bridge-bot
content: <drortirosh> Is there an rips site yet? Last time I checked, there isn't even a DNS entry for rips.ethereum.org (re @SamWilsn: Would make the most sense to integrate rendering the two sites, but I'm not sure what the plan is overall.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> There is not, need to do a bunch of work to make RIPs into a site, even ercs.ethereum.org doesn't really work. since the EIPs/ERCs split the site(s) need some work (re @drortirosh: Is there an rips site yet? Last time I checked, there isn't even a DNS entry for rips.ethereum.org)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<ulerdogan> The spec has not changed, just changed to address misunderstandings. It's aligned with chain implementation. (re @dcposch: I don't quite understand why the RIP returns empty data instead of 0 / 1 now. https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/pull/19/files#r1602718444

In that case, how does a contract tell whether the precompile exists?)
